thread.title: Skindred laid bare in new documentary
thread.title_full: Skindred laid bare in new documentary

title: Skindred laid bare in new documentary
text:
0 comments 
SKINDRED are set to release a 17 year in the making documentary film entitled Rude Boys For Life. 
It looks at life on the road, its ups and downs, celebrations, festival appearances and headline shows, studio access and their Polish Woodstock headline show where the band played to over a million people. 
Directed by band member Dan Sturgess, Rude Boys For Life offers a revealing and exclusive behind-the-scenes look at one of rock music’s best live bands. Taken from over 1,000 hours of footage filmed by the band over their 17 year career, Skindred’s Rude Boys For Life chronicles the band’s rise. It covers the making of all six studio albums, including new album, Volume, and includes exclusive, unseen, behind the scenes footage of five world tours. It chronicles the early days: from touring the USA in a van, to the birth of the now infamous Newport Helicopter at Download Festival 2011, culminating in their headline set to a million people at Polish Woodstock. Share article 
Skindred will also support the new album with a national tour, starting at 02 Guildhall Southampton on November 4. 
Call 023 8063 2601 or visit 02guildhallsouthampton.co.uk. Promoted Stories Skindred laid bare in new documentary
